alert.note: Alert for Northern Elko County; South Central Elko County; Southeastern Elko County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 19 at 3:50PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Elko County through 415 PM PDT... At 349 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 18 miles south of Contact to 15 miles northeast of Wells to 7 miles west of Pequop Summit to 12 miles east of Clover Valley. Movement was east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Heavy rainfall along with gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Oasis, Pequop Summit and Hd Summit. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Northern Elko County; South Central Elko County; Southeastern Elko County
